Package com.intellij.openapi.editor

Class GenericLineWrapPositionStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.openapi.editor.GenericLineWrapPositionStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LineWrapPositionStrategy
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DefaultLineWrapPositionStrategy, PyLineWrapPositionStrategy

    public class GenericLineWrapPositionStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
implements LineWrapPositionStrategy
    Highly customizable LineWrapPositionStrategy implementation.

    Not thread-safe.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  GenericLineWrapPositionStrategy.Rule
      Encapsulates information about rule to use during line wrapping.
      static class  GenericLineWrapPositionStrategy.WrapCondition
      Defines how wrapping may be performed for particular symbol.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateWrapPosition

        public int calculateWrapPosition(Document document,
                                 Project project,
                                 int startOffset,
                                 int endOffset,
                                 int maxPreferredOffset,
                                 boolean allowToBeyondMaxPreferredOffset,
                                 boolean isSoftWrap)
        Description copied from interface: LineWrapPositionStrategy
        Allows to calculate the most appropriate position to wrap target line.
        Specified by:
        calculateWrapPosition in interface LineWrapPositionStrategy
        Parameters:
        document - target document which text is being processed
        project - target project
        startOffset - start offset to use with the given text holder (exclusive)
        endOffset - end offset to use with the given text holder (exclusive)
        maxPreferredOffset - this method is expected to do its best to return offset that belongs to (startOffset; maxPreferredOffset] interval. However, it's allowed to return value from (maxPreferredOffset; endOffset) interval unless 'allowToBeyondMaxPreferredOffset' if 'false'
        allowToBeyondMaxPreferredOffset - indicates if it's allowed to return value from (maxPreferredOffset; endOffset] interval in case of inability to find appropriate offset from (startOffset; maxPreferredOffset] interval
        isSoftWrap - identifies if current request is for isSoftWrap wrap position
        Returns:
        offset from (startOffset; endOffset) interval where target line should be wrapped OR -1 if no wrapping should be performed

      • canUseOffset

        protected boolean canUseOffset(Document document,
                               int offset,
                               boolean virtual)

      • addRule

        public void addRule(GenericLineWrapPositionStrategy.Rule rule)
             throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Registers given rule with the current strategy.
        Parameters:
        rule - rule to register
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if another rule for the same symbol is already registered within the current strategy
